docs.snippet: The document was signed by a doctor who figures prominently in Russia’s current doping crisis....
docs.lead_paragraph: The document was signed by a doctor who figures prominently in Russia’s current doping crisis.
docs.abstract: Document dating to 1983 detailing Soviet Union's doping scheme ahead of 1984 Olympic games and testimony from former chief medical doctor Grigory Vorobiev point to long timeline of Russia's state-sponsored doping; Russian doping has been spotlighted once again at 2016 Olympics in Brazil.

headline.main: The Soviet Doping Plan: Document Reveals Illicit Approach to ’84 Olympics
headline.print_headline: A Secret Soviet Doping Plan, Decades Old, Echoes in Rio

byline.contributor: Ivan Nechepurenko contributed reporting from Moscow.

docs.snippet: The on-again, off-again breakup of an all-male Japanese pop group with a strong following in much of Asia is back on: The five members of SMAP will go their separate ways at the end of this year, after performing together for more than two decades...

docs.snippet: Japanese boy band SMAP will break up at the end of the year, its promoter said on Sunday, disappointing legions of fans in Japan and Asia just seven months after its members pledged to stay together....

docs.lead_paragraph: Paul Coffa, one of weightlifting’s best-known coaches and administrators who has been involved in the sport for more than half a century, has blamed former Soviet Bloc countries for persistent cheating that has once more damaged the image of the sport at the Rio Olympics.
